title: Speaking Part 3: Technology and Entertainment
content:
Read the extract from a Part Three speaking test and complete the gaps using one of the words below. Type your answers in the spaces provided.

Word bank: a little, fewer, a few, less, little, few

questions.instructions: Complete the text using words from the word bank provided above.
questions.question: How do you think technology has affected the way in which we entertain ourselves?
field_labels: Well, I think it has had an enormous impact on hobbies such as listening to music and to a lesser extent watching movies, especially for the younger generation. I think it must have affected the number of people who buy CDs for example. I think that 1. ________ people must buy them now as so much music is available on the internet.
Amongst younger people, there is 2. ________ enthusiasm for accumulating a CD collection; most of us today just stream music directly online.
I suppose there is 3. ________ more interest in traditional CDs amongst older people though!
Regarding watching movies, although 4. ________ of my friends are still interested in going to the cinema, I think more and more of us are starting to watch more online.

I suppose the concept of sitting in front of a computer to watch a movie doesn't appeal to everyone though and I suppose relatively 5. ________ people in my parent's age group would do that, they still prefer the comfort of a cinema.

I like going to the cinema to watch a blockbuster movie, especially if it has special effects as they are so much more impressive on the big screen. I am 6. ________ interested in going to watch ordinary films though as it is so expensive in comparison to buying a cinema ticket.
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You have correctly identified the appropriate quantifier.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Not quite right. Consider whether the noun is countable or uncountable, and whether the meaning is positive or negative.
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is shown above. Remember: 'few/fewer/a few' are used with countable nouns, while 'little/less/a little' are used with uncountable nouns.
